project.name: Soundscape for Android
project.description: An Android app to help people with visual impairments explore and navigate.

tags.description: To callout when a user is near a village, hamlet, town etc. This happens when moving faster than walking speed e.g. by bus or train.

The app uses highways to describe a user's location and intersections ahead of them.
The app uses railways to add context to a user's location e.g. on path next to railway.
The app uses water tags to add context to a user's location e.g. on path next to River Dee.
The app uses names wherever possible when describing nearby features.
The sidewalk tag is crucial for trying to simplify complex urban data. If a user is on a sidewalk, then unless it's named, they are described as traveling along the adjacent highway.
The app changes behaviour when it is inside a building, it won't callout roads and places that are outside the building.
The app uses the entrance tag to better describe the location of a building.
The app adds context to paths e.g. path via tunnel to park.

The app adds context to paths e.g. path via steps to park.
The destination tag is used to add context to unnamed highways e.g. path to park.
The destination tag is used to add context to unnamed highways e.g. path from park.
Special consideration is given to roundabouts when describing them as intersections.
If there's no tactile_paving tag, and a crossing is tagged as unmarked then we don't call it out to users.
